intro: Collaea crassifolia, commonly known as the thick-leaved collaea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the eastern regions of Australia, particularly in New South Wales and Queensland. The plant is characterized by its large, thick, leathery leaves that are often covered in a fine pubescence. It produces showy, pale yellow to cream-colored flowers that bloom in summer. Collaea crassifolia is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
